Class oracle.plsql.PByteArray

Class oracle.plsql.PByteArray 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.plsql.PValue
           |
           +----oracle.plsql.PByteArray
public class PByteArray
extends PValue
This class encapsulates byte array for use in PL/SQL RAW and LONG RAW.

PByteArray(int)
Constructs a PByteArray for RAW or LONG RAW.
PByteArray(int, byte[])
Constructs a PByteArray for RAW or LONG RAW and initialize the content.
PByteArray(byte[])
Constructs a PByteArray for RAW or LONG RAW, uses the given byte array as the buffer.

byteArrayValue()
Returns the value of this PByteArray as a byte array.
clone()
Clone this PByteArray.
copy(PByteArray)
Copies the PByteArray.
getByteArray(byte[])
Extracts the value of this PByteArray in a byte array.
length()
Returns the length of this PByteArray.
setValue(byte[])
Sets the value of this PByteArray.
toString()
Returns the String representation of this PByteArray.
useBuffer(boolean)
Specifies whether this buffer should be used directly in PL/SQL execution.

PByteArray 
  public PByteArray(int length)
Constructs a PByteArray for RAW or LONG RAW.
Parameters:
length - the length of the byte array
PByteArray 
  public PByteArray(int length,
                    byte value[])
Constructs a PByteArray for RAW or LONG RAW and initialize the content.
Parameters:
length - the length of the byte array
value - the initial content of the byte array
PByteArray 
  public PByteArray(byte value[])
Constructs a PByteArray for RAW or LONG RAW, uses the given byte array as the buffer.
Parameters:
value - the byte array to use

byteArrayValue 
  public byte[] byteArrayValue()
Returns the value of this PByteArray as a byte array. A copy of the byte array is returned. You should use isNull() to determine if this value is NULL before getting the value.
Throws: NullValueException
If the value is NULL.
See Also:
isNull
getByteArray 
  public void getByteArray(byte buffer[])
Extracts the value of this PByteArray in a byte array. You should use isNull() to determine if this value is NULL before getting the value.
Parameters:
buffer - the byte array to store the value
Throws: NullValueException
If the value is NULL.
See Also:
isNull
setValue 
  public void setValue(byte value[])
Sets the value of this PByteArray. To set this PByteArray to null, either pass a null byte array or use setNull().
Parameters:
value - the double value to set
See Also:
setNull
useBuffer 
  public void useBuffer(boolean use)
Specifies whether this buffer should be used directly in PL/SQL execution. Default is false. This may speed up the performance of PL/SQL execution by minimizing memory copy. However, if the same PL/SQL procedure or function is used repeatedly with different buffers, it will perform better by not using this buffer. In such a case, the wrapper class will allocate its own buffer to serve all calls.
Parameters:
use - use this buffer or not
length 
  public int length()
Returns the length of this PByteArray.
clone 
  public synchronized Object clone()
Clone this PByteArray.
Overrides:
clone in class PValue
copy 
  public void copy(PByteArray value)
Copies the PByteArray.
Parameters:
value - the PValue to copy from
toString 
  public String toString()
Returns the String representation of this PByteArray.
Overrides:
toString in class PValue
